Objective. To study the antimicrobial susceptibility of six vaginal probiotic lactobacilli. Methods. The disc di ﬀ usion method inClara Silva,

ATCC29213. Minimal Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) with 21 di ﬀ erent antibiotics in LAPTg agar and broth was also deter-3
mined. Results. LAPTg and MRS agars are suitable media to study antimicrobial susceptibility of lactobacilli. However, the NCCLS1
procedure needs to be standardized for this genus. The MICs have shown that all Lactobacillus strains grew at concentrations aboveNuevo Hospital El Milagro, Salta 4400, Argentina
10 µ g/mL of chloramphenicol, aztreonam, norfloxacin, ciprofloxacin, ceftazidime, ceftriaxone, streptomycin and kanamycin. Four2

lactobacilli were sensitive to 1 µ g/mL vancomycin and all of them were resistant to 1000 µ g/mL of metronidazole. Sensitivity toFacultad de Bioqu´ımica, Qu´ımica y Farmacia, Universidad Nacional de Tucum´an, Tucum´an 4000, Argentina
other antibiotics depended on each particular strain. Conclusions. The NCCLS method needs to be standardized in an appropri-3

ate medium to determine the antimicrobial susceptibility of Lactobacillus. Vaginal probiotic lactobacilli do not display uniformCentro de Referencia para Lactobacilos (CERELA-CONICET), Chacabuco 145, Tucum´an 4000, Argentina
susceptibility to antibiotics. Resistance to high concentrations of metronidazole suggests that lactobacilli could be simultaneously
